modules.description: Provides functions to create, simulate, and analyze a Gaussian mixture model with two components, compute its precision-recall curve, estimate parameters from data, and calculate the area under the curve. Works with Gaussian distributions characterized by means, standard deviations, and class proportions. Used to generate synthetic datasets for evaluating binary classification performance and to compute exact precision-recall metrics.

Computes Precision-Recall curves and their AUC using labeled predictions and true labels. Operates on arrays of float probabilities and integer class labels. Used to evaluate binary classification models against ground truth data.

Calculates precision-recall curves and their areas under the curve using Gaussian mixture models with two components, enabling analysis of binary classification performance. Supports parameter estimation from data, curve simulation, and evaluation of class proportion impacts. Operations include curve generation, AUC computation, and statistical analysis under the binormal assumption. Examples include generating synthetic data for classifier testing and computing exact precision-recall metrics for performance assessment.
